body.name: Weird True Stories That Sound Made Up: A Collection of Insane-But-True Stories About Pop Culture, Science, History, And More To Satisfy Your Curious Brain

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun interesting stories
reviews.reviewText: It’s very light reading. The stories are short and to the point. Easily able to keep your attention and the facts stick in your mind.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Interesting moments in history
reviews.reviewText: Trivia masters probably already know this stuff, but I didn't.Here are bits and bites of interesting moments in history that you might have missed. Or if you're cramming for that upcoming battle against the reigning Trivia King, some of these tidbits might prove to be your Ace up the sleeve72

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Strange and Unusual True Tales
reviews.reviewText: This was a fun book and audio book about strange and unusual tales from history. I knew about several, but it was interesting to learn about the others. All are nice, bite sized tales of unusual occurrences that are great for trivia games and history class. I listened to this on audio and enjoyed the strange tales.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Strange but true
reviews.reviewText: Interesting facts', all true but not well known. Fun to read. The mystery is in the why these events happened.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Interesting tidbits of history that makes it fun to learn. These can be used for added facts for memory recall.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A great go-to source for those game night trivia games
reviews.reviewText: The things I learned from reading this book... ! We humans are really strange. This book was fun to read and had some great information. Short (can I say "and sweet"?) chapters that make this an easy book to get through. In my house, we have regular game nights and I will be adding some of these stories to our trivia questions. My family won't believe some of these things!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Needs a better fact checker
reviews.reviewText: Full disclosure, I stopped reading the book. First, the typos and grammar errors were hard to ignore. The reason I didn't finish though was the blatantly wrong information. I was going to consider these minor interpretive errors to keep the stories concise. I can't overlook them when they are so wrong that misinformation is spread. A fact checker could have corrected things like the number of states in 1920. The author asserts 50; there were 48. So, I skimmed a few after this and found more factual errors. Also, the references sections needs to be cleaned up and listed by chapter or properly in alphabetical order. As it stands now it is an unorganized mess with more typos.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quick easy read
reviews.reviewText: Lots of interesting human interest stories. An easy but enjoyable book to read. I recommend this book to all who like history.
